Generation III.Ruby: Seviper shares a generations-long feud with Zangoose . The scars on its body are evidence of vicious battles. This Pok é mon attacks using its sword-edged tail.
Generation III.Sapphire: Seviper 's swordlike tail serves two purposes - it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pok é mon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose .
Generation III.Emerald: Seviper and Zangoose are eternal rivals. It counters a Zangoose 's dazzling agility with its swordlike tail, which also oozes a horrible poison.
Generation III.FireRed: It sharpens its swordlike tail on hard rocks. It hides in tall grass and strikes unwary prey with venomous fangs.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It sharpens its swordlike tail on hard rocks. It hides in tall grass and strikes unwary prey with venomous fangs.

Generation IV.Diamond: For many generations, it has feuded with Zangoose . It whets its bladed tail on rocks for battle.
Generation IV.Pearl: For many generations, it has feuded with Zangoose . It whets its bladed tail on rocks for battle.
Generation IV.Platinum: For many generations, it has feuded with Zangoose . It whets its bladed tail on rocks for battle.
Generation IV.HeartGold: In battle, it uses its bladed tail to counter any Zangoose . It secretes a deadly venom in its tail.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: In battle, it uses its bladed tail to counter any Zangoose . It secretes a deadly venom in its tail.

Generation V.White: For many generations, it has feuded with Zangoose . It whets its bladed tail on rocks for battle.

Generation V.White 2: Constant polishing makes the edge of the blade on its tail extremely sharp. It's Zangoose 's archrival.
